body.p: United States major general. Virginia native. Graduate of the United States Military Academy at West Point in 1840. Veteran of the Mexican War. Instructor of cavalry and artillery at West Point from 1851 to 1854. Stationed at frontier duty in California and Texas from 1855 to 1860. Served in General Patterson's Army in 1861. Promoted to Brigadier General and assigned to the Department of the Cumberland under General Robert Anderson. Became second in command to the Army of the Ohio in September 1862. Promoted to Major General in 1864.
